text: Two liquids X and Y having the same mass are supplied with the same quantity of heat. If the temperature rise in X is twice that of Y, the ratio of specific heat capacity of X to that of Y is
explanation:
MC\(x_\theta\) = MC\(y_\theta\)
\(x_\theta\) = 2 \(\times y_\theta\)
MC(2\(y_\theta\)) = MC\(y_\theta\)⇒ 2C = C=1 : 2

text: What is the velocity of sound at 100 oC if the velocity of sound at 0 oC is 340ms -1?
explanation:
\(V \propto \sqrt{T}\)
⇒ \(\frac{V_{1}}{\sqrt{T_{1}}} = \frac{V_{2}}{\sqrt{T_{2}}}\)
Using the above formula, we get
\(V_{2} \approxeq 397ms^{-1}\)

text: To convert a galvanometer to a voltmeter, a

options.A: high resistance is connected to it in series
options.B: high resistance is connected to it in parallel
options.C: low resistance is connected to it in parallel
options.D: low resistance is connected to it in series

explanation:
To convert a galvanometer (which measures current) into a voltmeter (which measures voltage), a high resistance is connected in series with the galvanometer. This limits the current flowing through the galvanometer, allowing it to measure higher voltages without exceeding its maximum current rating.
